definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Thereby , the basis of penal responsibility of ministration defect sin is varied .
sentences.chinese: 職務過失犯罪刑事責任的根據呈多元性的特點。

sentences.english: India's culture is marked by a high degree of syncretism and pluralism.
sentences.chinese: 印度文化以高度的融合性和多元性而著稱。

sentences.english: Such single- mindedness is particularly striking given the city's diversity.
sentences.chinese: 考慮到該城的多元性，民衆如此專一尤其令人喫驚。

sentences.english: and I think that because... from a long time ago  there were, it was just a very diverse city.
sentences.chinese: 而且很久前，這裏就是個多元性的城市。

sentences.english: So it's very necessary to analyse the diversification of foreign effects.
sentences.chinese: 因此，分析戴望舒詩歌外來影響的多元性是必要的。

sentences.english: This paper verifies the explicatability and foreseeability of this metatheory , and also shows the principles of its polysystematic study.
sentences.chinese: 同時還指出其多元性研究中應遵循的基本原則。

definition: pluralism, philosophical doctrine that the universe consists of different substances
